data.text: @drjowinchester Thanks, will have a read when I get some time to look over properly.

@drjowinchester @colourmeamused_ to ban their use as a proxy for all sorts of things that don't make any sense by bodies like random private workplaces etc. They can try but it doesn't seem to do much in the current climate.

@drjowinchester @colourmeamused_ I'd like to believe that, but we're seeing a lot of these sorts of medical devices used as proxies for all sorts of things that don't follow logic. It's not a TGA problem at the end of the day, it's a political and social problem. Once they're out in the wild the TGA doesn't get

@drjowinchester @gasman_al If your friends want more test subjects I'm a three doses of vaxx, two doses of covid (Dec /Feb) nerd who is more than happy to drop blood on these things in the name of science 😜

@scotthill222 @colourmeamused_ But as I said above TGA is pretty ruthless. They aren't going to approve its use it for anything that isn't clinically relevant. Or you may be able to access it for your own piece of mind but then not request another jab from it if it hasn't undergone the research (which it has)

@scotthill222 @drjowinchester But say there’s a new variant, and they test blood from someone who received the same vaccine doses with nAbs levels similar to Joanna, in that case iirc the neutralisation results can be extrapolated too.

This was how they did the very first studies for Omicron.

@colourmeamused_ @drjowinchester Yeah. Just thinking about how badly a bunch of untested hypotheses and false equivalence being jammed into policy space has gone. Not to say it's not a good thing to develop and test, just that there's huge potential for this kind of stuff to be misused on bad assumptions.
@colourmeamused_ @scotthill222 No thats not the case anymore. It was, but now it's easier.
